title: Alicia Vikander looks elegant at Earthquake Bird premiere
text:
She's starring opposite Riley Keough and Naoki Kobayashi in Netflix 's upcoming noir mystery, Earthquake Bird.

And Alicia Vikander was the picture of elegance when she attended the London premiere of her new film on Thursday, putting in a glamorous appearance on the red carpet.

The star, 31, looked lovely in a simple black dress with glittering embellishment at the collar.

Stunning: Alicia Vikander was the picture of elegance when she attended the London premiere of her new film Earthquake Bird on Thursday, putting in a glamorous appearance on the red carpet

Alicia's high-necked number boasted puffball sleeves and an ankle-length cut, set off with a pair of satin heels.

She wore her hair pinned back in a high bun and opted for a slick of rosy lipstick to complete her look.

The film takes viewers to 1989 Tokyo, following expat Lucy Fly (Vikander) and her intense love triangle with her boyfriend Teji and new friend Lily (Kobayashi and Keough).

Chic: She wore her hair pinned back in a high bun and opted for a slick of rosy lipstick to complete her look

Simple: Alicia's high-necked number boasted puffball sleeves and an ankle-length cut, set off with a pair of satin heels

New role: Alicia plays Lucy, who is seen being questioned by police when her friend mysteriously disappears, in the first look trailer for Earthquake Bird

Lucy is seen being questioned by police when Lily mysteriously disappears, in the first look trailer.

Director Wash Westmoreland leads the film to chronicle Lucy's head-over-heels relationship with her handsome photographer beau.

But there seems to be trouble for Vikander's Lucy when new-to-town Lilly seems to get too comfortable around her man.

The star looks worn down in the trailer's first scene, as she sits, make-up free and with a cold, tired look on her face, as she is questioned by police.

Who dun it: The star looks worn down in the trailer's first scene, as she sits, make-up free and with a cold, tired look on her face, as she is questioned by police

New friend: She stars opposite Riley Keough (Lily) and Naoki Kobayashi (Teji) in Netflix's upcoming noir mystery, out in November

The beau: Director Wash Westmoreland leads the film to chronicle Lucy's head-over-heels relationship with her handsome photographer beau. But there seems to be trouble for Vikander's Lucy when new-to-town Lilly seems to get too comfortable around her man

The clip then goes back in time, showing events before Lucy disappeared and how they women met and got along.

While starting a bludgeoning friendship with the new-to-Tokyo Lily, while also being in a relationship with her boyfriend.

Teji seems to be completely taken by Lucy, snapping photos of her at every moment, though she remains stoic and calm.

Before: The clip then goes back in time, showing events before Lucy disappeared and how they women met and got along

Tension: But the tension between the leading ladies seems to heat up as Lily is heard calling Teji, 'gorgeous,' before the trio are seen walking into the ocean together to swim

Before Lily: Teji seems to be completely taken by Lucy, snapping photos of her at every moment, though she remains stoic and calm

But the tension between the leading ladies seems to heat up as Lily is heard calling Teji, 'gorgeous,' before the trio are seen walking into the ocean together to swim.

'Love, obsession, betrayal' flash on the screen. A scene quickly changed from Lucy and Teji kissing to a scene of Lily and Teji.

Lily seems to be an enticing character who gets close to people fast but becomes concerned about her new situation, saying 'It feels like something really bad is gonna happen.'

Couple: The couple was spotted locking lips

Throuple or cheating: A scene quickly flashed of Lily and Teji looking hot and steamy

Lily: Lily seems to be an enticing character who gets close to people fast but becomes concerned about her new situation, saying 'It feels like something really bad is gonna happen'

Josh Hutson, Kiki Sukezane and Ken Yamamura also star in the film produced by Ridley Scott.

Vikander most recently starred in 2018's Tomb Raider as Lara Croft. While Keough as in Under the Silver and Logan Lucky.

Newcomer to US films, Kobayashi has done Japanese films and shows after being in J-Pop group Exile.

More stars: Josh Hutson (pictured) Kiki Sukezane and Ken Yamamura also star in the film produced by Ridley Scott

Earthquake Bird will have a world premiere at the BFI London Film Festival on October 10.

It will also get a limited release on November 1, before streaming on Netflix November 15.

The film is a based on the novel, of the same name, by Susanna Jones.
description: Alicia Vikander was the picture of elegance when she attended the London premiere of her new film Earthquake Bird on Thursday, putting in a glamorous appearance on the red carpet.
